lines: You are in the house, bored, with ABSOLUTELY nothing to do. (Your mother keeps telling you, "Read a book.") You look over at the telephone and wonder, "How many children in town, in this state, in this country, IN THIS WHOLE WORLD, are
bored at this very second?" Why not try to make a new friend?
"Alabama State Penitentiary, may I help you?"
"I'm sorry, the number you have reached is out of service or temporarily disconnected. Please check the number and try again. This is a recording."
"Myong hi hee op tter nee mwaa."
"YOUNG LADY, WHAT DO YOU THINK YOU ARE DOING?" Oops, it's Mom on the extension. Now you have something to do. Go to your room.
This doesn't sound like a very worthwhile telephone call. Do you want to try again?
About three weeks later, your mother asks your father if he knows where these peculiar telephone calls came from.
Because you are usually so trustworthy, you are never discovered.
Suddenly, both of them turn to one another and say your name. The next day, a telephone lock is installed on the phone. P.S., this is only the beginning of your love affair with the telephone.
You have excellent impulse control for a child your age.

You have evidently thought long and hard about the possibility of randomly dialing telephone numbers. Your freedom to play outside for the next week and your parents' telephone bill have both been spared. Thoughtfulness and
